title: Your Child Hates Math? Here's How to Change Their Attitude
excerpt: Math doesn't have to be the enemy. Discover how to turn the subject into a positive and empowering experience.
author: Smart Worksheets Team
content:
Why Do Children Develop a Hatred for Math?

Usually it stems from frustration, accumulated gaps in basic understanding, or an early experience of failure. The good news: it's reversible.

Find Their Strength

Start from there. If they're good at geometry but struggle with multiplication, strengthen their success in geometry and approach multiplication through shapes.

Try our geometry generator to build confidence.
